channel.title: Mac on Ain't a creature shitting out of mouth
channel.description: Recent content in Mac on Ain't a creature shitting out of mouth

item.title: Android studio and Frida on Apple silicon M2
item.description: Install Android Studio and run an AVD on MacbookPro(M2) install with brew: $ brew install --cask android-studio search and run Android Studio from Spotlight choose, “More Actions” from the main popup, then “Virtual Device Manager” Install Android SDK Platform-Tools for Mac Download the platform tools (https://developer.android.com/tools/releases/platform-tools?hl=en) Unzip the downloaded file(ex, platform-tools_rXX.X.X-darwin.zip) Move the unzipped folder somewhere and create a symbolic link to it $ sudo ln -s /Users/XXX/local/platform-tools/adb /usr/local/bin/adb Run a virtual device Device ((added a Pixel 6 device with Release S - API 31, ABI arm64-v8a, Android 12.
